verses.kjv: When Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father in law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, and that the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt;
verses.web: Now Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, how LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt.
verses.ct: Jethro, the priest of Midian and Moses' father-in-law, heard about everything God had done for Moses and for his people Israel — how the LORD had brought them out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Then Jethro, Moses’ father in law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her back,
verses.web: Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, received Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her away,
verses.ct: Earlier, Moses had sent his wife Zipporah back to her father, and Jethro had taken her in,

verses.kjv: And her two sons; of which the name of the one was Gershom; for he said, I have been an alien in a strange land:
verses.web: and her two sons. The name of one son was Gershom, for Moses said, “I have lived as a foreigner in a foreign land”.
verses.ct: along with her 2 sons. The first was named Gershom, because Moses had said, "I have been a foreigner in a foreign land."

verses.kjv: And the name of the other was Eliezer; for the God of my father, said he, was mine help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh:
verses.web: The name of the other was Eliezer, for he said, “My father’s God was my help and delivered me from Pharaoh’s sword.”
verses.ct: The second was named Eliezer, because Moses had said, "My father's God was my help and rescued me from Pharaoh's sword."

verses.kjv: And Jethro, Moses’ father in law, came with his sons and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness, where he encamped at the mount of God:
verses.web: Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, came with Moses’ sons and his wife to Moses into the wilderness where he was encamped, at the Mountain of God.
verses.ct: Now Jethro brought Moses' wife and sons out to him in the wilderness, where Moses was camped near the mountain of God.

verses.kjv: And he said unto Moses, I thy father in law Jethro am come unto thee, and thy wife, and her two sons with her.
verses.web: He said to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, have come to you with your wife, and her two sons with her.”
verses.ct: He sent word to Moses: "I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you, along with your wife and her 2 sons."

verses.kjv: And Moses went out to meet his father in law, and did obeisance, and kissed him; and they asked each other of their welfare; and they came into the tent.
verses.web: Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and bowed and kissed him. They asked each other of their welfare, and they came into the tent.
verses.ct: Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, bowed before him, and kissed him. They asked how each other was doing, and then went into the tent.

verses.kjv: And Moses told his father in law all that the LORD had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, and all the travail that had come upon them by the way, and how the LORD delivered them.
verses.web: Moses told his father-in-law all that LORD had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardships that had come on them on the way, and how LORD delivered them.
verses.ct: Moses told his father-in-law everything the LORD had done to Pharaoh and the Egyptians for Israel's sake — all the hardships they had faced along the way, and how the LORD had rescued them through it all.

verses.kjv: And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which the LORD had done to Israel, whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.web: Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which LORD had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.ct: Jethro was overjoyed at all the good things the LORD had done for Israel by rescuing them from the Egyptians.

verses.kjv: And Jethro said, Blessed be the LORD, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh, who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.web: Jethro said, “Blessed be LORD, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh; who has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.ct: Jethro said, "Praise the LORD, who rescued you from the Egyptians and from Pharaoh himself — who freed the people from Egypt's grip.

verses.kjv: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods: for in the thing wherein they dealt proudly he was above them.
verses.web: Now I know that LORD is greater than all gods because of the way that they treated people arrogantly.”
verses.ct: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods, because he defeated them in the very way they arrogantly oppressed his people."

verses.kjv: And Jethro, Moses’ father in law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God: and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses’ father in law before God.
verses.web: Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God. Aaron came with all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
verses.ct: Then Jethro brought a burnt offering and sacrifices to God. Aaron and all the elders of Israel came and shared a meal with Moses' father-in-law in God's presence.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses sat to judge the people: and the people stood by Moses from the morning unto the evening.
verses.web: On the next day, Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood around Moses from the morning to the evening.
verses.ct: The next day, Moses took his seat to settle disputes among the people. They stood around him from morning until evening.

verses.kjv: And when Moses’ father in law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand by thee from morning unto even?
verses.web: When Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, “What is this thing that you do for the people? Why do you sit alone, and all the people stand around you from morning to evening?”
verses.ct: When his father-in-law saw everything Moses was doing for the people, he said, "What exactly are you doing here? Why are you handling all of this alone, with everyone standing around you from morning to night?"

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto his father in law, Because the people come unto me to enquire of God:
verses.web: Moses said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to inquire of God.
verses.ct: Moses answered, "The people come to me to seek God's guidance.

verses.kjv: When they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between one and another, and I do make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.
verses.web: When they have a matter, they come to me, and I judge between a man and his neighbor, and I make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.”
verses.ct: Whenever they have a dispute, they bring it to me. I settle the matter between them and teach them God's statutes and laws."

verses.kjv: And Moses’ father in law said unto him, The thing that thou doest is not good.
verses.web: Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing that you do is not good.
verses.ct: His father-in-law replied, "What you're doing isn't good.

verses.kjv: Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that is with thee: for this thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.
verses.web: You will surely wear away, both you, and this people that is with you; for the thing is too heavy for you. You are not able to perform it yourself alone.
verses.ct: You're going to burn yourself out — and the people too. This job is too heavy for you. You can't do it alone.

verses.kjv: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people to God-ward, that thou mayest bring the causes unto God:
verses.web: Listen now to my voice. I will give you counsel, and God be with you. You represent the people before God, and bring the causes to God.
verses.ct: Listen to my advice, and may God be with you. You should be the one who represents the people before God and brings their cases to him.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt teach them ordinances and laws, and shalt shew them the way wherein they must walk, and the work that they must do.
verses.web: You shall teach them the statutes and the laws, and shall show them the way in which they must walk, and the work that they must do.
verses.ct: Teach them God's statutes and laws. Show them how they should live and what they should do.

verses.kjv: Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, and rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:
verses.web: Moreover you shall provide out of all the people able men which fear God: men of truth, hating unjust gain; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.ct: But also look for capable men from among all the people — men who fear God, who are honest, and who hate dishonest profit. Appoint them as leaders over groups of 1,000, 100, 50, and 10.

verses.kjv: And let them judge the people at all seasons: and it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge: so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.
verses.web: Let them judge the people at all times. It shall be that every great matter they shall bring to you, but every small matter they shall judge themselves. So shall it be easier for you, and they shall share the load with you.
verses.ct: Let them handle disputes for the people all the time. They can bring the difficult cases to you, but they should settle the smaller matters themselves. That will lighten your load because they'll share the burden with you.

verses.kjv: If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.
verses.web: If you will do this thing, and God commands you so, then you will be able to endure, and all these people also will go to their place in peace.”
verses.ct: If you do this — and God directs you to — you'll be able to keep going, and all these people will go home satisfied."

verses.kjv: So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father in law, and did all that he had said.
verses.web: So Moses listened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said.
verses.ct: Moses listened to his father-in-law and did everything he suggested.

verses.kjv: And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.web: Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.ct: He chose capable men from all of Israel and appointed them as leaders over the people — over groups of 1,000, 100, 50, and 10.

verses.kjv: And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
verses.web: They judged the people at all times. They brought the hard cases to Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
verses.ct: From then on, these men settled disputes among the people all the time. They brought the difficult cases to Moses, but handled every smaller matter themselves.

verses.kjv: And Moses let his father in law depart; and he went his way into his own land.
verses.web: Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went his way into his own land.
verses.ct: Then Moses said goodbye to his father-in-law, and Jethro returned to his own land.
